summary_reasoning: Assumptions are explicit and concentrated in the Fair Value and Profit Drivers and Valuation Model Summary sections, with clear quantitative inputs tied to forecasts and the DCF. Specificity is strong: units, magnitudes, and horizons are stated (e.g., 2025–29 revenue CAGR, margin ranges, AUM organic growth, COE/WACC, long-run tax rate, Stage II EBI growth, perpetuity year). Justification is solid, referencing multi-year organic AUM growth history and margin performance and linking drivers (ETF scalability, product mix/realization rate, fee compression) to outcomes. Internal consistency between narrative and tables is clean; the key figures reconcile across sections, and the scenario targets map coherently to valuation impacts. Sensitivity is robustly handled via quantified bull/bear scenarios that vary material levers (revenue CAGR, margin trajectory, product mix/realization rate) and show fair value per-share outcomes. Overall, the report provides traceable, auditable assumptions that drive forecasts and valuation, including share count and payout frameworks, with minimal ambiguity and clear causal drivers.

assumptions_extracted.quote: We are currently forecasting 4.4% (3.9%) average annual organic AUM growth during 2025-29 (2025-34), with a standard deviation of 1.0% (1.5%).
we are projecting 8.4% top-line growth on average annually during 2025-29.
We envision the firm generating adjusted operating margins in a 43%-47% range during 2025-29
We use a 21% US statutory corporate tax rate and a 9% cost of equity in our valuation.

assumptions_extracted.quote: We project a bull-case fair value estimate of $1,630 per share ... an 12.3% compound annual growth rate for revenue during 2025-29 ... adjusted operating margins exceeding 50% by the end of our five-year projection period.

Our downside-case fair value estimate of $630 per share ... a 6.1% CAGR for revenue during 2025-29. We also assume BlackRock's adjusted operating margins drop below 40% before the end of our five-year forecast period
